subject: Re: 12-150 alternate hack, little bit easier
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
Andy, 

I'll try that with the next one, it seems much easier.  The way i 
originally did it only took 10 minutes though, but breaking a solder 
connection does seem better.

Thanx,
-Steve H.



--- In EVP-ITC@...m, "ourobouros2k2" <ourobouros2k2@...> 
wrote:
>
> Full credit to Steve Hultay for discovering the hackability of this
> radio, and as he had mentioned in the past, it really wasn't the
> easiest. After tearing it apart, cutting, desoldering, etc...to 
locate
> the mute wire/pin/solder pad, I found out that it can be one of the
> easiest hacks out there. 
> 
> Rather than disassembling and such, simply cut the trace on each 
side
> of the mute pin solder pad. Takes about 30 seconds with a hobby 
knife.
> I felt really stupid after 4 hours taking everything apart and
> desoldering wires, etc...
> 
> instructions with photos can be found on my blog if interested. 
> 
> http://blog.myspace.com/index.cfm?
fuseaction=blog.view&friendID=405441717&blogID=445524854
> 
> The sound quality of this thing really rocks, and I love the 
external
> antenna options...
> 
> thanks 
> Andy
>
